name: add_global_p-str:type
desc: set argument default for `add_global_p.tbl_regression(type=)` and `add_global_p.tbl_uvregression(type=)`

name: add_global_p-str:type
desc: set argument default for `add_global_p.tbl_regression(type=)` and `add_global_p.tbl_uvregression(type=)`; default is `"III"`

name: add_p.tbl_summary-attr:test.categorical
desc: default test for categorical/dichotomous variables

name: add_p.tbl_summary-attr:test.categorical.group_by2
desc: default test for categorical/dichotomous grouped/correlated variables with a 2-level by variable

name: add_p.tbl_summary-attr:test.categorical.low_count
desc: default test for categorical/dichotomous variables with minimum expected count <5

name: add_p.tbl_summary-attr:test.continuous
desc: default test for continuous variables with a 3- or more level by variable

name: add_p.tbl_summary-attr:test.continuous.group_by2
desc: default test for continuous grouped/correlated variables with a 2-level by variable

name: add_p.tbl_summary-attr:test.continuous_by2
desc: default test for continuous variables with a 2-level by variable

name: add_p.tbl_svysummary-attr:test.categorical
desc: default test for categorical/dichotomous variables

name: add_p.tbl_svysummary-attr:test.continuous
desc: default test for continuous variables

name: as_flex_table-lst:addl_cmds
desc: named list of expressions of {flextable} package commands inserted in the `as_flex_table()` call; do not include the `data=` argument; the list of expressions is inserted after the named call, e.g. if the named list element is `"tab_spanner"` the expressions will be inserted after expressions named `"tab_spanner"`; to see the names of the expressions run `as_flex_table(x, return_calls = TRUE)` and check the names.

name: as_gt-lst:addl_cmds
desc: named list of expressions of {gt} package commands inserted in the `as_gt()` call; do not include the `data=` argument; the list of expressions is inserted after the named call, e.g. if the named list element is `"tab_spanner"` the expressions will be inserted after expressions named `"tab_spanner"`; to see the names of the expressions run `as_gt(x, return_calls = TRUE)` and check the names.

name: as_hux_table.gtsummary-lst:addl_cmds
desc: named list of expressions of {huxtable} package commands inserted in the `as_hux_table()` call; do not include the `data=` argument; the list of expressions is inserted after the named call, e.g. if the named list element is `"tab_spanner"` the expressions will be inserted after expressions named `"tab_spanner"`; to see the names of the expressions run `as_hux_table(x, return_calls = TRUE)` and check the names.

name: as_kable-arg:dots
desc: named list of arguments passed to `knitr::kable()`, which also applies to calls from `as_kable_extra()`

name: as_kable_extra-lst:addl_cmds
desc: named list of expressions of {kableExtra} package commands inserted in the `as_kable_extra()` call; do not include the `data=` argument; the list of expressions is inserted after the named call, e.g. if the named list element is `"tab_spanner"` the expressions will be inserted after expressions named `"tab_spanner"`; to see the names of the expressions run `as_kable_extra(x, return_calls = TRUE)` and check the names.

name: pkgwide-fn:prependpvalue_fun
desc: function to style p-values throughout package that include a "p" prefix, e.g. "p<0.001" or "p=0.12"; this is common in the `inline_text()` functions; default is `function(x) style_pvalue(x, prepend_p = TRUE)`

name: pkgwide-fn:pvalue_fun
desc: function to style p-values throughout package; default is `style_pvalue`

name: pkgwide-lgl:quiet
desc: logical indicating whether to suppress messages or not; default is `FALSE`

name: pkgwide-str:ci.sep
desc: string indicating separator between upper and lower bounds of confidence intervals. Default is `", "`

name: pkgwide-str:language
desc: string indicating language; default is `"en"`

name: pkgwide-str:print_engine
desc: string indicating the default print engine; default is `"gt"`

name: pkgwide-str:theme_name
desc: optional name of theme; name is printed when theme loaded

name: pkgwide-fun:pre_conversion
desc: function that is executed on the gtsummary object before it is converted with `as_gt()`, `as_flex_table()`, etc. Must be a function that can be run on every and any gtsummary object

name: tbl_regression-fn:addnl-fn-to-run
desc: a function that will be executed after at the end of each `tbl_regression()` call

name: tbl_regression-chr:tidy_columns
desc: character vector of columns from `tidy_fun=` tibble to print. 'estimate' column will always be printed. Select among columns 'conf.low', 'conf.high', 'std.error', 'statistic', or 'p.value'.

name: tbl_regression-lst:tidy_plus_plus
desc: Additional `tidy_plus_plus()` arguments. Cannot be one of `model=`, `tidy_fun=`, `exponentiate=`, `variable_labels=`, `show_single_row=`, `intercept=`, `include=`, `conf.level=`, `conf.int=`, or `strict=` as these are controlled by `tbl_regression()`. The default value for the additional arguments is `list(conf.int = TRUE, add_header_rows = TRUE, add_estimate_to_reference_rows = FALSE)`.
example: list(conf.int = TRUE, add_header_rows = TRUE, add_estimate_to_reference_rows = TRUE)

name: tbl_regression-str:coef_header
desc: string setting the default term for the beta coefficient column header; default is `"Beta"`

name: tbl_regression-str:ref_row_text
desc: string indicating the text to print on reference rows (default is an em-dash)

name: tbl_stack-str:group_header
desc: string indicating the group column header used in `as_tibble()`, `as_flex_table()`, etc. where row headers are not supported; default is `"**Group**"`

name: tbl_summary-fn:addnl-fn-to-run
desc: a function that will be executed after at the end of each `tbl_summary()` call

name: tbl_summary-fn:N_fun
desc: function to style integers. Currently questioning...THIS MAY BE REMOVED IN A FUTURE RELEASE. Use `style_number-arg:big.mark` and `style_number-arg:decimal.mark` instead.

name: tbl_summary-fn:percent_fun
desc: function to style percentages; default is `style_percent`

name: tbl_summary-str:default_con_type
desc: string indicating the default summary type for continuous variables; default is `"continuous"`; update to `"continuous2"` for multi-line summaries of continuous variables

name: tbl_summary-str:missing_stat
desc: string indicating the statistic(s) to present on the missing row. The default is `"{N_miss}"`. Select among `c("N_miss", "N_obs", "p_miss", "N_nonmiss", "p_nonmiss")`

name: tbl_summary-str:header-noby
desc: string indicating the statistic header when there is no by variable present

name: tbl_summary-str:header-withby
desc: string indicating the statistic header when there is a by variable present

name: tbl_svysummary-fn:addnl-fn-to-run
desc: a function that will be executed after at the end of each `tbl_svysummary()` call

name: tbl_svysummary-str:header-noby
desc: string indicating the statistic header when there is no by variable present

name: tbl_svysummary-str:header-withby
desc: string indicating the statistic header when there is a by variable present

name: add_difference-fn:addnl-fn-to-run
desc: a function that will be executed after at the end of each `add_difference()` call
